title: Gaza’s remaining hospitals will stop working in two days, health officials warn
content: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.
summary: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.

title: Hurricane Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
content: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands
summary: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands

title: Turnout high in French elections as voters weigh far-right rule
content: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.
summary: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.

title: The French far right is leading in election polls. Here’s what to know.
content: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.
summary: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.

title: How one family escaped North Korea in a rickety boat on the open sea
content: Almost no one has been able to defect from North Korea since Kim Jong Un shut the borders in 2020. But this family made a terrifying bid for freedom — and succeeded.
summary: Almost no one has been able to defect from North Korea since Kim Jong Un shut the borders in 2020. But this family made a terrifying bid for freedom — and succeeded.

title: U.S. suspends Gaza aid pier again; fighting continues in Shejaiya
content: U.S.-built pier is again suspended due to high seas, says Pentagon. The U.N. warns “at least 60,000 people” have been displaced from Gaza’s Shejaiya area as fighting continues.
summary: U.S.-built pier is again suspended due to high seas, says Pentagon. The U.N. warns “at least 60,000 people” have been displaced from Gaza’s Shejaiya area as fighting continues.

title: The far right was humiliated in this city. Its return bodes ill for Macron.
content: The port city of Toulon helps explain the far right’s appeal in France and, critics say, the risks of entrusting it with government responsibilities.
summary: The port city of Toulon helps explain the far right’s appeal in France and, critics say, the risks of entrusting it with government responsibilities.

title: Iran heads to presidential runoff pitting reformist against conservative
content: Turnout in the first round of voting hit a historic low. But some people hope the pro-reform candidate’s will mobilize voters ahead of the runoff July 5.
summary: Turnout in the first round of voting hit a historic low. But some people hope the pro-reform candidate’s will mobilize voters ahead of the runoff July 5.

title: In Egypt, Gaza evacuees live in the shadows: ‘Everything is closing in’
content: Displaced Palestinians in Cairo have found sanctuary from war and a measure of calm, but are unable to build a future.
summary: Displaced Palestinians in Cairo have found sanctuary from war and a measure of calm, but are unable to build a future.

title: Airline apologizes after plane left passengers in wheelchairs on tarmac
content: An EasyJet flight left Belfast as Liz Weir, who uses a wheelchair, waited on the tarmac to board.
summary: An EasyJet flight left Belfast as Liz Weir, who uses a wheelchair, waited on the tarmac to board.

title: As tensions soar, U.S. pushes for deal to avert Israel-Lebanon war
content: The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah says its fighters won’t stand down from attacking Israel until there is a permanent cease-fire in Gaza.
summary: The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah says its fighters won’t stand down from attacking Israel until there is a permanent cease-fire in Gaza.

title: Iran extends voting hours in snap election for a new president
content: For Iran’s ruling clerics, the public’s participation in elections is important to maintain the regime’s legitimacy, even as Iranians grow more disillusioned.
summary: For Iran’s ruling clerics, the public’s participation in elections is important to maintain the regime’s legitimacy, even as Iranians grow more disillusioned.

title: Orphaned as babies, these elephants returned to the wild amid bittersweet tears
content: Kapai and her herd were “rewilded” this month after years in an innovative Kenyan sanctuary, where keepers restored their health and prepared them to live free.
summary: Kapai and her herd were “rewilded” this month after years in an innovative Kenyan sanctuary, where keepers restored their health and prepared them to live free.

title: Homeland Security extends temporary protected status for Haitians
content: The expansion makes an additional 309,000 Haitians eligible for temporary protected status.
summary: The expansion makes an additional 309,000 Haitians eligible for temporary protected status.

title: How the world reacted to Biden’s ‘disastrous’ debate performance
content: If global leaders weren’t already hedging their bets about a future Trump presidency, they sure are now.
summary: If global leaders weren’t already hedging their bets about a future Trump presidency, they sure are now.
